answers.answer: As a parent of a 9 year old, I thank you for your letter.  A close family friend has been diabetic for over 60 years, and my daughter gets a little freaked out when he explains how he had to do shots years ago.  The technology improvements are simply amazing, but they will never replace a cure.  As a parent, when my kids get hurt there is something tangible I can do to make them feel better.  Hugs and band-aids and the like are ways I can make my kids feel better immediately.  The most frustrating thing about diabetes is that, beyond small things like making sure she checks her sugars and that we count carbs right, there is nothing I can do.  My only avenue to deal with that frustration is to try to raise money for a cure as well as helping people manage it on a daily basis.  That's one of the reasons I'm a volunteer on these forums.Anyway, Merry Christmas everyone!!
